  Token Kantei=
 Hiketsu doesn't say much about Kiyomune. On the Ni=F4 it 
  has this to sa=
y in part;

  "Tachi no sugata haba semaku, kasane atsushi, (shodai Kiyozan=
e) ooku 
  wa sugu-ha ni yakutari, ni dai-mei wa midare ha ni shite nie kom=
aka 
  ni, boshi maruku, kaeri fukaku, hi o kakitaru mono ooshi. nakago wa =

  mijikaku, mune wa koniku ni shite ha no ho mo onaji, katayama gata 
  na=
ri..."
  Among the images in this section it shows a handrawn oshigata of 
=
  Kiyomune, and though it is far from photographic it shows that his 
  yas=
uri-mei was katte-sagari, the mune on his nakago was kaku and he 
  used ku=
rijiri instead of the more characteristic katayama.
  Tsunaishi in Nihonto =
no Kantei to Kansho breaks it down into Ko-Ni=F4 
  and Sue Ni=F4 school an=
d has a good two pages of info, however Kiyomune 
  is not mentioned and do=
es not appear in his "family tree" for this 
  school.
  I have added two s=
cans to my new folder, Nihontoryu in the photos 
  section along with some =
photos of sutff I saw in Japan on a recent 
  trip but unrelated to this or=
 any other thread...
  -t

  PS check the English edition of Token Bijutsu =
issues 13 and 42 for 
  info on Kiyozane
